Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Overview:
Opportunity to work in a hybrid model: potential to work 4 days per week from home.

The Sr Oracle Application Developer is a top-level technical expert in one or more highly specialized areas of applications systems analysis and programming. This position acts independently under general direction, provides technical leadership and should be an expert in business or functional area. This team member formulates/defines system scope and objectives and devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time and form of desired results. The Sr Oracle Application Developer prepares detailed specifications and is responsible for developing, unit testing, debugging and documentation. This team member should have full technical knowledge of all phases of applications systems analysis and programming, and is accountable for providing work estimates and may be responsible for multiple phases of a project. Responsibilities will also include guiding/directing and checking the work of other developers.
Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Why GM Financial?

If you have a vision for working collaboratively in an agile team to implement highly available and secure cloud technologies - we have the role, career, and challenge that you are looking for! Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Overview:
GM Financial is seeking experienced, passionate and creative Site Reliability Engineers for current and future opportunities! The position will be responsible for supporting cloud infrastructure architecture and components, including hybrid cloud and Public Cloud platforms. The Site Reliability Engineer will be responsible for configuration, efficiency, and performance of the deployed public cloud solutions. The scope of the role includes not only cloud engineering, but advanced level automation capabilities, and even some overlap into software development disciplines.

Why Work for Us
Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. We're a passionate, diverse group that strives for a work environment that inspires productivity and flexible collaboration. If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity within a team that highly values their employees, then you should consider working with us.

Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Overview:
Opportunity to work in a Hybrid Model, work four days per week from home.

Why GM Financial?

At GM Financial, were looking for an experienced and highly motivated Manager – Site Reliability Engineer. We are expanding our efforts into complementary data technologies for decision support in areas of ingesting and processing large data sets. Our interests are in enabling data science and Machine Learning applications on large and low latent data sets in both a batch and streaming context for processing.

To that end, this role will engage with team counterparts in exploring, deploying, and reliably operate technologies for holding data sets created using a combination of batch and streaming transformation processes. These data sets support both off-line and in-line machine learning training and model execution. Other data sets support search engine-based analytics. Exploration and deployment of technologies activities include identifying opportunities that impact business strategy, selecting data solutions software, and defining hardware requirements based on business requirements. Responsibility also includes documentation of procedures for deployment, monitoring, managing, and switching the environments in production and disaster recovery sites. This role participates along with team counterparts to architect an end-to-end framework developed on a group of core data technologies.
Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Software Engineering Manager is accountable for the engineering and operational aspects of the product, including the technology decisions, how well the team delivers on business priorities, value stream efficiency (how work gets done), and the performance of the product. The Software Engineering Manager is actively engaged in developing the skills of the team to not only efficiently deliver high quality solutions but coaching team members to become T-shaped and adaptable to any situation. The Software Engineering Manager owns the architecture, quality, and performance of the product. As such, the Software Engineering Manager must stay abreast of technology evolution and guide the team as a servant leader to make good product design decisions. The Software Engineering Manager manages up and manages out to promote the team's accomplishments and build relationships within the larger organization to get work done.As a technical manager, you set the boundaries and expectations for delivering a quality product and timely solutions. You are an avid promoter of process improvement. You seek out and promote best practices. You own and refine the technical architecture, working with the team to continually refactor the product to eliminate technical debt and incorporate modern tools, languages, and engineering practices. As a people manager, you consistently invest in your people to grow their technical skills and soft skills; you celebrate successes; you identify books, classes, events, and assignments that expose team members to new ways of thinking and working; you promote inter-team and intra-team collaboration to build trust; you hire good people, effectively manage poor performers, and you provide constant feedback to create a team of leaders.As a servant leader, you inspire, motivate, and enable the team. You avoid tasking the team members. You rise above the urgent and focus on the long view, spending time researching and understanding where the product is headed; planning out the architecture decisions, tools, and skills needed to get there. You are able to do this because your team members, working collaboratively within the Scrum team, decide what tasks and features to work on day to day to meet our business needs.
Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Are you interested in leading and developing a team that is passionate about User Experience & Design?

There has never been a better time to work for General Motors IT!

In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function.

Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and maintains infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM's global operations.

From designing and building the next generation of vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet.

Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as web clients, mobile clients, native clients, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, business intelligence, AI/ML, robotics, manufacturing PLC communication, API Development, and Data Modeling/Development.

We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.



Manufacturing IT is responsible for leading a dynamic and fast paced organization to provide systems solutions to support and optimize how we manufacture our vehicles.

From designing and building the next generation of systems to refining current systems, our team focuses on delivering sustainable, resilient, scalable, and intuitive systems.

Our team delivers world-class solutions to optimize manufacturing processes and introduce new system solutions and platforms to expand upon.

We are driving real change in an iconic automaker that's highly invested in build a new future.



As a Software Development Manager, you will be leading and delivering innovative software solutions that are well-designed, scalable, and provide a high-quality user experience.

You will ensure that software is designed and developed using sound, repeatable and industry standard methodologies, including but not limited to standards in code quality, performance, stability, security, and overall alignment and compliance with project objectives.

























































The median level of salary compensation for this role is $107,484 - $139,584



An incentive pay program offers payouts based on company performance, job level, and individual performance.



GM offers a variety of health and well-being benefit programs. Benefit options include medical, dental, vision, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, retirement savings plan, sickness and accident benefits, life insurance, paid vacation & holidays, tuition assistance programs, employee assistance program, GM vehicle discounts and more.

Job_Description:

There has never been a better time to work for General Motors IT!

Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and sustains technology solutions that enable company's global operations.

From designing and building the next generation of vehicles to developing a world-class experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet.

Our team delivers enterprise IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as vision engineering, artificial intelligence, machine learning, web applications, robotics, sensor communications, business intelligence and data modeling.

We offer challenging positions for passionate individuals looking to advance their careers with an organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.

Manufacturing IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization. We create and sustain systems solutions to optimize how we manufacture our vehicles.

Our team focuses on delivering sustainable, resilient, and intuitive solutions.

We are driving real change in an iconic automaker that's highly invested in building a new future.





This is a unique opportunity to help build a brand-new UX/UI Design and Architecture team in the Global Manufacturing IT space. This team will be focused on designing the user experience for the many applications that power our manufacturing plants, as well as managing multiple InnerSource reusable component library projects. Building vehicles is at the core of GM's business and this person will have an opportunity to be a part of bringing our plants into the electric future we're all striving for.

As the Lead React Developer, on this new team, you will be responsible for leading a high-visibility React reusable library product, which provides a suite of libraries to development teams, embodying our UX/UI design standards. With this project being run as an InnerSource effort (internal Open Source), you'll also be responsible for engaging with both the community of developers using the product, as well as the community of contributors and maintainers. You will work alongside the UX/UI designers on the team to promote good design, as well as React development best practices. This role embodies a passionate, yet pragmatic development leader that can analyze community needs and behaviors, successfully transform sometimes ambiguous requirements into quality product features, and chart a long-term course for one of our core products.

In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast-paced organization that crafts, develops, and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM's global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing an outstanding GM experience for our dealers and customers driving real change in the most iconic automaker in the world. Our team provides software solutions that bridge the gap between Product Development and Manufacturing. Our team delivers outstanding enterprise-wide IT solutions in groundbreaking technologies such as mobility, telematics, important business systems, cloud, and vehicle engineering. We use modern platforms (Pivotal Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes), JavaScript frameworks (React, Angular), and databases (PostgreSQL). We offer exciting positions for hardworking professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization passionate about innovation, speed, and adding business value.

There are several exciting opportunities currently within the Manufacturing Engineering IT organization. In this role, you will not only be responsible for developing software to handle business problems but will also be creating applications that will have a positive impact within several departments ranging from Pre-Production, General Assembly, Propulsion, to Electric Vehicles. You will work hands-on writing software or solutions based on detailed requirements and system specifications. In addition, you will also have the chance to create and contribute to existing CI/CD pipelines, learn about using containerization technologies (Docker and Kubernetes), write code hosted in a Cloud platform, and design reusable components and microservices. You will further improve your skills and knowledge by working closely with senior developers, architects, and business partners. Directly to enhance the software that interfaces with GM Plant devices, machines and drive processes on factory floor throughout various sites.

Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

The Global Product Development Group (GPD) is seeking innovative Entry Level Software Engineers to build state-of-the-art software platforms. This early career development program is designed to develop new employees, and prepare them fora future with GM. This is accomplished by providing work assignments andnetworking opportunities that expose them to different, interfacing roles in criticaland emerging business areas. In parallel, the engineers develop business acumen,strategic technical skills, relationships, and excellence that grow as they progressthrough the program. The result is an employee that is prepared to fit directly intoa variety of roles, quickly add valueand move the company forward. This program requires a two-year commitment and consists of four 6-month rotational assignments within the Product Engineering organization as part of our TRACK (Technical Rotation and Career Knowledge) program.

: Software engineers design, develop, test and architect SW for intended functionality. Vehicles have multiple SW stacks ranging from Low level SW, embedded SW, Object Oriented SW, Offboard SW (Cloud, Edge). Software Engineers utilize codes, algorithms, embedded systems, and architect software to optimize controller resources and throughput. This software will run throughout our vehicle ecosystem, so you will be able to do hands-on work that can directly affect our customers. Understanding Agile methodology.

Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired. This position requires employee to be onsite 1-3x per week.

In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast-paced organization that crafts, develops, and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM's global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing an outstanding GM experience for our dealers and customers driving real change in the most iconic automaker in the world. Our team provides software solutions that bridge the gap between Product Development and Manufacturing. Our team delivers outstanding enterprise-wide IT solutions in groundbreaking technologies such as mobility, telematics, important business systems, cloud, and vehicle engineering. We use modern platforms (Pivotal Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes), JavaScript frameworks (React, Angular), and databases (PostgreSQL). We offer exciting positions for hardworking professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization passionate about innovation, speed, and adding business value.

There are several exciting opportunities currently within the Manufacturing Engineering IT organization. In this role, you will not only be responsible for developing software to handle business problems but will also be creating applications that will have a positive impact within several departments ranging from Pre-Production, General Assembly, Propulsion, to Electric Vehicles. You will work hands-on writing software or solutions based on detailed requirements and system specifications. In addition, you will also have the chance to create and contribute to existing CI/CD pipelines, learn about using containerization technologies (Docker and Kubernetes), write code hosted in a Cloud platform, and design reusable components and microservices. You will further improve your skills and knowledge by working closely with senior developers, architects, and business partners. Directly to enhance the software that interfaces with GM Plant devices, machines and drive processes on factory floor throughout various sites.

Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePallets and software that leverages real-time data to drive intelligent optimizations for e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team, based in Palo Alto, with offices in Atlanta and Detroit, that is customer-focused, agile, and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired. This position requires employee to be onsite 1-3x per week

There has never been a better time to work for General Motors IT!

Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and sustains technology solutions that enable company's global operations.

From designing and building the next generation of vehicles to developing a world-class experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet.

Our team delivers enterprise IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as vision engineering, artificial intelligence, machine learning, web applications, robotics, sensor communications, business intelligence and data modeling.

We offer challenging positions for passionate individuals looking to advance their careers with an organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.

Manufacturing IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization. We create and sustain systems solutions to optimize how we manufacture our vehicles.

Our team focuses on delivering sustainable, resilient, and intuitive solutions.

We are driving real change in an iconic automaker that's highly invested in building a new future.



This is a unique opportunity to help build a brand-new UX/UI Design and Architecture team in the Global Manufacturing IT space. This team will be focused on designing the user experience for the many applications that power our manufacturing plants, as well as managing multiple InnerSource reusable component library projects. Building vehicles is at the core of GM's business and this person will have an opportunity to be a part of bringing our plants into the electric future we're all striving for.

As the Lead Angular Developer, on this new team, you will be responsible for leading a high-visibility Angular reusable library product, which provides a suite of libraries to development teams, embodying our UX/UI design standards. With this project being run as an InnerSource effort (internal Open Source), you'll also be responsible for engaging with both the community of developers using the product, as well as the community of contributors and maintainers. You will work alongside the UX/UI designers on the team to promote good design, as well as Angular development best practices. This role embodies a passionate, yet pragmatic development leader that can analyze community needs and behaviors, successfully transform sometimes ambiguous requirements into quality product features, and chart a long-term course for one of our core products.

We are looking for a Senior Robotics Engineers who are innovative, creative, problem solvers who get things done!

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, weare buildinga team ofpeople who are passionate about creating safer,better,and more sustainablesolutions. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how thetransportationin the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Vision as a Service (VaaS) is an organization within GM IT, building innovative solutions supporting global manufacturing, leveraging current and emerging technologies. One of our initiatives is to protect workers from repetitive, mundane, and dangerous tasks.

Are you a robot engineer with passion for designing prototypes, building and testing robot cells, who envisions using your ideas, electrical/mechanical knowledge to build advanced technological real-time software applications?

If you want a place thatchallengesyou to bring yourcuriosity, enthusiasm,desiretolearn, grow,and succeedevery day,to buildautomotivesolutionsthat are the benchmark for other automotive companiesand suppliers, then this is the place for you.

The will drive the identification, evaluation, and adoption of rapid iterative and incremental robotics software solutions together with our Manufacturing Engineering business partners. Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePallets and software that leverages real-time data to drive intelligent optimizations for e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team - based in Palo Alto, with offices in Atlanta and Detroit - that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product management and operations, BrightDrop is looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and rigorous thinking to deliver a better future.
Backed by General Motors, BrightDrop is striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.

As Staff Software Engineer in the Delivery Intelligence Group, you will be a driving force in developing software systems that unlock BrightDrop's ecosystem of last-mile delivery vehicles for customers. You will lead engineering of the core meso-scale agent-based simulation environment that BrightDrop uses to develop and demonstrate algorithms to control and optimize goods delivery. The simulator is a flexible, high-performance, reactive engine inspired by the latest in gaming technology, capable of simultaneous two-way communication with human users, internal & external APIs, and internally developed AI controllers. You will work with data engineering to develop data pipelines based on simulation that unlock optimization and AI learning at scale.

Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid work position:

This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired. In the USA, this is an employee who lives 100 miles or less from their designated, primary worksite.

This position requires an employee to be onsite every other week.

We are currently seeking experienced and motivated candidates for the role of SIL SIE (Software-in-the-Loop Simulation Integration Engineer) to support the Virtual Design Development Validation (VDDV) group. This role is part of a group responsible for creating virtual environments to enable calibration, verification, and validation of embedded controllers for engine, transmission, hybrid, electrification, chassis.

The Simulation Integration Engineer is responsible for leading the move to virtual engineering by leading the integration of full-vehicle cross-functional co-simulation packages that are used for all aspects of vehicle development. This position involves high level of collaboration with teams throughout General Motors including VDDV, Vehicle Motion Embedded Controls (VMEC), Calibration, Algorithm, Vehicle Performance, Validation, and Hardware Development. This position requires an individual with a passion for virtualization, an adept knowledge of hardware and software integrated systems, and a demonstrated capability to manage a wide variety of technical and customer needs. He or she will work as a liaison between the Plant Modeling team, Tools team, and internal development teams, to integrate and deliver simulation environments on time and with quality. A balance of technical and project leadership skills and the ability to think outside the box to find simple yet exciting solutions is paramount.




































BS Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or Aerospace Engineering required.

MS Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or Aerospace Engineering preferred.

Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired. This position requires employee to be onsite 1-3x per week

There has never been a better time to work for General Motors IT!

Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and sustains technology solutions that enable company's global operations.

From designing and building the next generation of vehicles to developing a world-class experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet.

Our team delivers enterprise IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as vision engineering, artificial intelligence, machine learning, web applications, robotics, sensor communications, business intelligence and data modeling.

We offer challenging positions for passionate individuals looking to advance their careers with an organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.

Manufacturing IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization. We create and sustain systems solutions to optimize how we manufacture our vehicles.

Our team focuses on delivering sustainable, resilient, and intuitive solutions.

We are driving real change in an iconic automaker that's highly invested in building a new future.



This is a unique opportunity to help build a brand-new UX/UI Design and Architecture team in the Global Manufacturing IT space. This team will be focused on designing the user experience for the many applications that power our manufacturing plants, as well as managing multiple InnerSource reusable component library projects. Building vehicles is at the core of GM's business and this person will have an opportunity to be a part of bringing our plants into the electric future we're all striving for.

As the Lead Angular Developer, on this new team, you will be responsible for leading a high-visibility Angular reusable library product, which provides a suite of libraries to development teams, embodying our UX/UI design standards. With this project being run as an InnerSource effort (internal Open Source), you'll also be responsible for engaging with both the community of developers using the product, as well as the community of contributors and maintainers. You will work alongside the UX/UI designers on the team to promote good design, as well as Angular development best practices. This role embodies a passionate, yet pragmatic development leader that can analyze community needs and behaviors, successfully transform sometimes ambiguous requirements into quality product features, and chart a long-term course for one of our core products.

As Sr. Manager, Embedded Software and Systems, you will build and lead the team developing embedded software for current and future generations of the BrightDrop EP1 (all-electric pallet). Along with the team you will lead and build, you will help drive key decisions on architecture, approach and execution that empower a suite of products that are smarter, more capable and highly robust in order to meet the efficiency needs of our last-mile e-commerce customers.

You will lead engineering development of an embedded platform that spans IoT, machine learning, controls, calibration, secure mobile access, propulsion, battery management and safety factors, leading team members specializing across these domains. You and your team will collaborate closely with your peers in hardware design and architecture to optimize our EP1 platform strategy and execution.

Our ideal candidate is both a strategic leader who can design robust architecture and a strong people leader who can ramp up and manage a high-performance team whose deliverables are key to our success and differentiation.

Title: Sr Oracle Application Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePalletsandsoftware that leverages real-time data todrive intelligent optimizationsfor e-commerce. Backed by General Motors, BrightDrop (gobrightdrop.com) is striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.



We are looking for an experienced to support the development of our last mile product portfolio including the BrightDrop EP1. In this role you will be an individual contributor responsible for creating firmware test cases, executing tests through various stages of the development cycle and continuously looking for ways to automate the tests. You will serve as a technical specialist who can work on programming various devices. You will possess extensive knowledge of coding and software development working side by side with product engineers to analyze and optimize designs with an innovative mindset and a high degree of creativity and initiative.

The Firmware Test Engineer will design and implement test scripts to ensure product functionality and robustness. You will collaborate with developers and validation engineers to develop and automate test cases and tools for firmware validation. Other duties will include creating test cases, executing tests, debugging issues and defect management (filing and validating resolved defects). You are also expected to incorporate client feedback into firmware revisions and to maintain awareness of technological developments and industry best practices. You should have a strong background in software programming languages, show great attention to detail and be able to work within a cross functional team in a fast-paced changing environment.

Title: Future Opportunity: Salesforce Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired. This position requires employee to be onsite 1-3x per week

There has never been a better time to work for General Motors IT!

Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and sustains technology solutions that enable company's global operations.

From designing and building the next generation of vehicles to developing a world-class experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet.

Our team delivers enterprise IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as vision engineering, artificial intelligence, machine learning, web applications, robotics, sensor communications, business intelligence and data modeling.

We offer challenging positions for passionate individuals looking to advance their careers with an organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.

Manufacturing IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization. We create and sustain systems solutions to optimize how we manufacture our vehicles.

Our team focuses on delivering sustainable, resilient, and intuitive solutions.

We are driving real change in an iconic automaker that's highly invested in building a new future.



This is a unique opportunity to help build a brand-new UX/UI Design and Architecture team in the Global Manufacturing IT space. This team will be focused on designing the user experience for the many applications that power our manufacturing plants, as well as managing multiple InnerSource reusable component library projects. Building vehicles is at the core of GM's business and this person will have an opportunity to be a part of bringing our plants into the electric future we're all striving for.

As the Lead Angular Developer, on this new team, you will be responsible for leading a high-visibility Angular reusable library product, which provides a suite of libraries to development teams, embodying our UX/UI design standards. With this project being run as an InnerSource effort (internal Open Source), you'll also be responsible for engaging with both the community of developers using the product, as well as the community of contributors and maintainers. You will work alongside the UX/UI designers on the team to promote good design, as well as Angular development best practices. This role embodies a passionate, yet pragmatic development leader that can analyze community needs and behaviors, successfully transform sometimes ambiguous requirements into quality product features, and chart a long-term course for one of our core products.





































Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Title: Future Opportunity: Salesforce Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePallets and software that leverages real-time data to drive intelligent optimizations for e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team - based in Palo Alto, with offices in Atlanta and Detroit - that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product management and operations, BrightDrop is looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and rigorous thinking to deliver a better future.

Backed by General Motors, BrightDrop is striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.

In this role you will be part of the Fleet Management application team; You will work in a pod of Product, Design, Web, Mobile, Backend and Quality superstars to build a beautiful, intuitive and frictionless fleet management platform that will help decarbonize the last mile! In this team we need your best creative thinking to create a product experience you are proud of. Come join us and let's innovate!

Title: Future Opportunity: Salesforce Developer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

Job Description

In this exciting and visible role, you will be responsible and accountable for the design, implementation, configuration, and successful transition to Operations of technologies in the assigned domain. This will include following standard installation recommendations, configuring the technologies to match the needs of the function being served, and delivering to project schedules. For this GM position, we expect you to have advanced mastery to function independently for day to day tasks. The role requires working with several technical teams to rationalize throughput and sizing demand to define efficient and effective solutions that bring together technologies from all areas. In this position you will often be an assigned technical resource to numerous project teams simultaneously. You will be required to work with numerous teams and balance competing requests, while meeting project deadlines. Additional responsibilities might include monitoring, performing maintenance, troubleshooting, and implementing corrective actions in support of continuing operations of the assigned domain.





Minimum of 6 years of Senior Level experience in the following:

There has never been a better time to work for General Motors IT!

Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and sustains technology solutions that enable company's global operations.

From designing and building the next generation of vehicles to developing a world-class experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet.

Our team delivers enterprise IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as vision engineering, artificial intelligence, machine learning, web applications, robotics, sensor communications, business intelligence and data modeling.

We offer challenging positions for passionate individuals looking to advance their careers with an organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.

Manufacturing IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization. We create and sustain systems solutions to optimize how we manufacture our vehicles.

Our team focuses on delivering sustainable, resilient, and intuitive solutions.

We are driving real change in an iconic automaker that's highly invested in building a new future.





This is a unique opportunity to help build a brand-new UX/UI Design and Architecture team in the Global Manufacturing IT space. This team will be focused on designing the user experience for the many applications that power our manufacturing plants, as well as managing multiple InnerSource reusable component library projects. Building vehicles is at the core of GM's business and this person will have an opportunity to be a part of bringing our plants into the electric future we're all striving for.

As the Lead React Developer, on this new team, you will be responsible for leading a high-visibility React reusable library product, which provides a suite of libraries to development teams, embodying our UX/UI design standards. With this project being run as an InnerSource effort (internal Open Source), you'll also be responsible for engaging with both the community of developers using the product, as well as the community of contributors and maintainers. You will work alongside the UX/UI designers on the team to promote good design, as well as React development best practices. This role embodies a passionate, yet pragmatic development leader that can analyze community needs and behaviors, successfully transform sometimes ambiguous requirements into quality product features, and chart a long-term course for one of our core products.

Job Description

In this exciting and visible role, you will be responsible and accountable for the design, implementation, configuration, and successful transition to Operations of technologies in the assigned domain. This will include following standard installation recommendations, configuring the technologies to match the needs of the function being served, and delivering to project schedules. For this GM position, we expect you to have advanced mastery to function independently for day to day tasks. The role requires working with several technical teams to rationalize throughput and sizing demand to define efficient and effective solutions that bring together technologies from all areas. In this position you will often be an assigned technical resource to numerous project teams simultaneously. You will be required to work with numerous teams and balance competing requests, while meeting project deadlines. Additional responsibilities might include monitoring, performing maintenance, troubleshooting, and implementing corrective actions in support of continuing operations of the assigned domain.

Title: BrightDrop Principal UX Architect Fleet Management
Job_Description:
Job Description

About You:
You have a rare combination of creative vision and capacity to execute, you can think systematically and create amazing experiences while getting into the nitty gritty of technical details, you are an amazing creative while staying humble and in collaboration with others. You love greenfield challenges where your designs can push the boundaries for what is possible to fully express your creative confidence and deep love for craft. As a Principal UX Architect, you will further build on your expertise of interaction & usability patterns,

Job Overview:

As a Principal UX Architect for the fleet management experience, you will be responsible for leading, creating and defining from scratch the holistic experience across our current and future commercial vehicles. This role will conceive and shape the core UX across devices -computer, tablet and mobile- for a complex set of users -delivery & fleet managers, dispatchers, safety managers, couriers and others. They will focus on core application and interaction designs in the areas of fleet configuration, fleet and delivery intelligence, route optimisation and more. You will be shaping the next wave of innovation around these product experience areas, while bringing coherence and unity to the experience spanning across platforms. The work spans many forms and exists in many contexts from in-vehicle settings all the way to cutting edge data-visualizations integrated with mapping and routing. This is about owning the design of an end-to-end experience, not just screens.
This is a fantastic opportunity for a creative that craves conceiving, building and shipping radically new experiences.

Title: BrightDrop Principal UX Architect Fleet Management
Job_Description:
Job Description

General Motor's Digital Design Studio is looking for a highly creative visual designer with a passion for Brand story-telling and creating compelling Brand Visions within the digital design space. Our goal is to create amazing and innovative brand experiences that re-imagine how our customers will experience our products in the future.

The ideal candidate will have a broad aesthetic style, understand the process to design products at a high functional level, and deliver a unique aesthetic sensibility for our automotive brands. Ideally we are looking for an Industrial Designer with a passion for UX and digital design. Automotive Design experience preferred but not essential.

You will work with a multidisciplinary team of designers from the Branded Studios, Advanced Design and UI to synthesize brand design and functional needs into our next generation of in-vehicle user experiences.

This job is primarily onsite but there is some room for flexibility under our Work Appropriately model.

If this sounds like your next step, we'd love to hear from you! There has never been a more exciting time to join General Motors!

Title: BrightDrop Principal UX Architect Fleet Management
Job_Description:
Overview:
Be a part of GM's vision to create a world of Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions, and Zero Congestion. The Conversation designer will own and influence the design of AI Chatbot solutions, designing the user experience for web/mobile-based virtual assistants (VAs). Among other activities, the Conversation Designer validates functionality choices, designs intuitive and adaptive dialog flows, builds dialogs, anticipates user responses, and optimizes grammar. Conversation Designers are expected to lead projects alongside a Product Owner and must be comfortable guiding the internal and client teams to the best outcome.As a Conversational Designer, you will need to learn about user populations and remain the authority on best practices in user-centered virtual assistant (VA) design.The Conversation Designer will collaborate with other designers, researchers, technologists, and business stakeholders to craft meaningful experiences for our customers through thoughtful voice and messaging strategies. The ideal candidate will have voice interaction and information design skills, an understanding of user-centered design, be able to analyze analytics and different data points, interview users and gather insights, and a passion for designing digital products

Title: Entry-Level Software Engineering Rotational Program
Job_Description:
Job Description

The Global Product Development Group (GPD) is seeking innovative Entry Level Software Engineers to build state-of-the-art software platforms. This early career development program is designed to develop new employees, and prepare them fora future with GM. This is accomplished by providing work assignments andnetworking opportunities that expose them to different, interfacing roles in criticaland emerging business areas. In parallel, the engineers develop business acumen,strategic technical skills, relationships, and excellence that grow as they progressthrough the program. The result is an employee that is prepared to fit directly intoa variety of roles, quickly add valueand move the company forward. This program requires a two-year commitment and consists of four 6-month rotational assignments within the Product Engineering organization as part of our TRACK (Technical Rotation and Career Knowledge) program.

: Software engineers design, develop, test and architect SW for intended functionality. Vehicles have multiple SW stacks ranging from Low level SW, embedded SW, Object Oriented SW, Offboard SW (Cloud, Edge). Software Engineers utilize codes, algorithms, embedded systems, and architect software to optimize controller resources and throughput. This software will run throughout our vehicle ecosystem, so you will be able to do hands-on work that can directly affect our customers. Understanding Agile methodology.

Title: Sr Project Manager - ITS
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Senior Project Manager leads key business and technology initiatives from initiation through production close-out for large and highly complex IT projects. Senior Project Managers are responsible for the coordination and completion of all aspects of project management on assigned PMO projects, including, but not limited to, project definition, project plans, conducting meetings, requirements gathering, overseeing development, testing, and implementation. This senior level position applies a detailed knowledge of the business, technology, and systems development life cycle to produce successful projects by organizing resources (time, cost, and people). The Senior Project Manager will support, coach, and mentor less experienced PMO Project Managers and Project Coordinators.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Oversee the overall planning, execution, and control of multiple large or highly complex projects to successful completion
Qualifications:

Title: Sr Project Manager - ITS
Job_Description:
Overview:
Opportunity to work in a hybrid model in Fort Worth, TX or Detroit, MI.

The Financial Analyst II - EPMO is responsible for assisting with conducting investment analysis, supporting business owners with preparing business cases in support of making sound investment decisions, collaborating with project owners to track and report total project costs and benefits realized. This individual will work to align and support the global PM community by functioning as a business partner to help adoption of financial concepts and processes in alignment with industry best practices, as well as ensuring adherence to GPPM financial processes across the enterprise.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Assist with training and maintaining enterprise tools for estimating project costs & benefits and documenting business cases

Title: Sr Project Manager - ITS
Job_Description:
Job Description

In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM's global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.





General Motors Global Manufacturing and Global Purchasing and Supply Chain (GPSC) IT are seeking highly motivated, diverse, and qualified individuals for opportunities as Project Managers and Scrum Masters. All team members work in cross-functional, collaborative environments and demonstrate GM's Cultural Behaviors of accountability, collaboration, integrity, and inclusion. Come be a part of the team that is driving the manufacturing and supply chain of the automotive future.



, you will lead multiple projects/teams facilitating daily stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint demo, retrospective meetings, and other project related activities.

Title: Sr Project Manager - ITS
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePallets and software that leverages real-time data to drive intelligent optimizations for e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team - based in Palo Alto, with offices in Atlanta and Detroit - that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product management and operations, BrightDrop is looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and rigorous thinking to deliver a better future.

Backed by General Motors, BrightDrop is striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.

The Product Security team at BrightDrop ensures the security of our products and services and are the domain experts for our engineering and IT teams to protect our customers' data in today's dynamic threat landscape. We are a team of highly skilled security engineers that specialize in security research, penetration testing, and security architecture. We evaluate a broad range of technologies including sophisticated web applications, IoT platforms, distributed processing, Cloud environments and isolation of entrusted code.

As a Hardware Technical Project Manager, you will work closely with the hardware engineering team to expand our electronic pallet and embedded device portfolio by bringing design concepts from early prototypes to full-scale production units. You will drive daily planning, tracking, development and validation activities to meet the overall project objectives, including major functionality, quality, and on-time delivery. You will also work with internal, cross-functional teams, such as product management, operations, procurement, customer service and system safety, in a fast-paced, business, technology, and operations environment.

The City of Poway is seeking two experienced Senior Management Analysts / Management Analysts in the Public Works Department. There is one vacancy in our Utilities Division and one vacancy in our Maintenance and Operations Division.

The Senior Management Analyst/Management Analyst provides administrative, budgetary, grant, and work-flow support to assigned departmental and/or divisional projects and programs; analyzes programmatic practices and procedures and makes recommendations for organizational, operational, policy, and procedural improvements; conducts needs analysis, feasibility studies, and program evaluations for assigned projects and programs; develops, summarizes, and maintains administrative and fiscal records; fosters cooperative working relationships among City departments and acts as a liaison with various community, public, and regulatory agencies.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Our organization is unique in that we are a nonprofit community resource that saves lives by working with volunteer donors to provide the highest quality blood & tissue components to patients. By using cutting-edge technology, our team of dedicated professionals has helped save hundreds of thousands of lives for more than 35 years. Over 200,000 components of life-saving blood and tissue from volunteers throughout South Texas are collected and tested each year. We are internationally recognized for the quality of our services and research. Donors are essential because patients are in constant need of blood, blood components, and/or tissue. It's about life! Share our excitement and join our team!
BioBridge Global (BBG) is a non-profit company that oversees and supports South Texas Blood & Tissue Center (STBTC), QualTex Laboratories, GenCure, and The Blood and Tissue Center Foundation. For over 40 years, our team of dedicated professionals has made life-saving connections. Our diverse services bridge critical medical industry needs with innovative solutions.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Definition and Class Characteristics
To perform responsible technical duties related to computer hardware and software customer support; provide project support for new and modified systems; and install and configure desktop and mobile computers and related software and peripheral equipment.
CLASS CHARACTERISTICS
Information Systems Analyst I - This is the entry level class in the Information Systems Analyst series that allows the incumbent to develop journey level knowledge and abilities. This class is distinguished from the journey level by the performance of the more routine tasks and duties assigned to positions within this series. Employees at this level are not expected to perform with the same independence of direction and judgment on matters allocated to the journey level. Employees work under general supervision while learning job tasks.

- This is the journey level class within the Information Systems Analyst series and is distinguished from the Information Systems Analyst I by the assignment of the full range of duties. Employees at this level receive only occasional instruction or assistance as new, unusual or unique situations arise and are fully aware of the operating procedures and policies within the work unit. This position will have an active role in database administration, network administration, infrastructure maintenance, applications technology, project management, cross-functional exposure and more.

Company_Name: ['US Assistant Secretary for Public and Indian Housing']
Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Duties
Making a Difference: HUD's Mission
HUD's mission is to create strong, sustainable, inclusive communities and quality affordable homes for all. HUD is working to strengthen the housing market to bolster the economy and protect consumers; meet the need for quality affordable rental homes; utilize housing as a platform for improving quality of life; build inclusive and sustainable communities free from discrimination and transform the way HUD does business.

As a Program Analyst, you will:
Serve as an expert advisor on all aspects of quality assurance housing voucher programs, including public housing agencies (PHA) performance, cost containment data integrity, and Departmental requirements.
This is a remote position; selectee will be required to work up to 50% of the time in a non-HUD owned space. The employee's workspace must be suitable for conducting business and as such, remote employees are expected to provide a secure, distraction-free, home-based worksite with reliable high speed internet connectivity. Selectees will be required to self-certify that their remote workplace meets all safety, privacy, and internet speed requirement.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Freeport-McMoRan is a leading international mining company with headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona. We operate large, long-lived, geographically diverse assets with significant proven and probable reserves of copper, gold, and molybdenum. The company has a dynamic portfolio of operating, expansion and growth projects in the copper industry. Freeport-McMoRan is one of the world’s largest publicly traded copper producers, the world’s largest producer of molybdenum and a significant gold producer. We have a long and successful history of conducting our business in a safe, highly efficient and socially-responsible manner.

We have the assets, the talent, the drive and the financial strength to provide attractive and rewarding careers of our employees. We encourage you to take the time to explore the opportunity to advance your career at Freeport-McMoRan.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
*This is an in-office position*
General Statement of Duties
This exempt position is responsible for providing process analysis to determine potential needs and identification of changes or improvements to the functionality and efficiency of these processes. Supports off the shelf software including installing, configuring, testing, monitoring and troubleshooting. Analyzes, designs, develops, and tests reports for business operations using client/server databases. Manages data gathering, queries, performs data analysis, and report writing for various projects, and business processes on request. Works with staff to determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and develop business intelligence and data warehouse (DW) strategy.
Supervision Received
Works under the supervision of the Information Technology Manager.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description

People Analytics CoE (Community of Expertise) is looking for a People Analytics Data Visualization Analyst to join its newly formed Talent Acquisition Analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, building, and managing Global Talent Acquisition (GTA) dashboards that provide key insights on our internal and external talent attraction and hiring activities. You will be responsible for managing a portfolio of Talent Acquisition Power BI dashboards and moving them to the next level where insights and recommendations are seamlessly embedded in every user interaction and every single chart. You will provide meaningful, easy to understand and actionable insights by connecting talent acquisition data with critical business outcomes through powerful data visualizations. Your storytelling, consulting, and technical skills as well as ability to extract key insights from multiple data sources and to put business problems into visual context will have a significant impact on our ability to enable data-driven insights across the organization. This role requires a strong dashboard and visualization technical development experience and analytical consulting skills. You will have a chance to influence our talent strategy, help design insights that matter and be part of a great team that puts innovation and curiosity at the center of everything we do.

Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePallets and software that leverages real-time data to drive intelligent optimizations for e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team - based in Palo Alto, with offices in Atlanta and Detroit - that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product management and operations, BrightDrop is looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and rigorous thinking to deliver a better future.

Backed by General Motors, BrightDrop is striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.

The Product Security team at BrightDrop ensures the security of our products and services and are the domain experts for our engineering and IT teams to protect our customers' data in today's dynamic threat landscape. We are a team of highly skilled security engineers that specialize in security research, penetration testing, and security architecture. We evaluate a broad range of technologies including sophisticated web applications, IoT platforms, distributed processing, Cloud environments and isolation of entrusted code.

As a Hardware Technical Project Manager, you will work closely with the hardware engineering team to expand our electronic pallet and embedded device portfolio by bringing design concepts from early prototypes to full-scale production units. You will drive daily planning, tracking, development and validation activities to meet the overall project objectives, including major functionality, quality, and on-time delivery. You will also work with internal, cross-functional teams, such as product management, operations, procurement, customer service and system safety, in a fast-paced, business, technology, and operations environment.

Job Description:

We are looking to grow our Connected Infotainment/Telematics Cellular Wireless test team to help GM further expand its leading global position in connected vehicles, features, and services!

You will be part of a team of experienced engineers who are helping to ensure we here at GM successfully deliver the latest cellular wireless technologies to our connected vehicles. This is a blossoming and innovative feature area that merges the latest technologies from the telecom and automotive industries.

The responsibilities of the Test Engineer will focus on authoring and running cellular wireless test procedures. These procedures enable features and services for the latest GM connected vehicle programs. In this role, you will work collaboratively within our team of like-minded peers to verify cellular connectivity behavior and identify, report, track, and resolve issues. You will also contribute to the design and development of automated test systems which further enhance GM's product development and test capabilities.

This is a terrific opportunity learn and grow while working collaboratively with GM, its suppliers, and partners to deliver the cellular connectivity that will enable the vehicles of the future.

Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description

General Motors' Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) group unlocks a new level of potential by further integrating our vehicles with their digital world. SDV has created Ultifi, a new vehicle intelligence platform, designed to unlock new vehicle experiences. With Ultifi, we will connect with customers through software-defined features, apps and services via Over-the-Air (OTA). The new platform works by separating key software from the hardware to simplify the OTA process, enabling us to provide more robust updates and cloud-services to our customers.

The SDV organization works on ADAS software, Infotainment Services, AI-based Apps, Energy (EV) & Connected Mobility Services, Software Architecture, Systems Engineering, Software Integration, Product and Program Management- all to provide cool features such as Super Cruise and Ultra Cruise to our customers. We embrace innovation and would love for you to join us in transforming the way software is developed and deployed in vehicles.

Think this could be a good fit for you? Are you interested to be a part of a collaborative, driven, and bold organization that embraces innovation and challenges? If you have experience in electrical engineering, software engineering, or computer science/programming and you're ready to go all-in to deliver vehicles that evolve digitally with our customers' lives, let's connect.

The Image Processing Controls group is responsible for leading the software testing development and implementation of best in-class and real-time viewing applications based on surround and trailering cameras for GM vehicles with innovative computer vision-based algorithms for our customers.

We're looking for a dedicated Vehicle Integration Engineer to join the group and test various software applications.

Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description

As we move towards our ZERO ZERO ZERO vision for the future, we are looking to add hardworking individuals to our Autonomous Vehicle Systems Validation team! On this team, we contribute to that vision by creating validation plans, carrying out those plans on vehicles, benches, simulation, and analysis, identifying issues, defining recovery plans, and reporting those results!

As a Lead System Validation Engineer (LSVE) you will be responsible for the validation plan for your assigned system. The LSVE is directly accountable for the planning and execution of the plan. In this role, you have the opportunity to define a test plan that includes simulation, analysis, automation, bench testing, and vehicle testing. Accurate and strong interpersonal skills are vital as the LSVE, since you share results and report validation status. As a team, we work together with our partners in System Engineering, System Safety, and integration to resolve issues and improve them relentlessly.

We believe work-life balance is essential to a team member's success and job satisfaction. This position allows some work flexibility to ensure our diverse team has good work-life balance. Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description
General Motors' Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) group unlocks a new level of potential by further integrating our vehicles with their digital world. SDV has created Ultifi, a new vehicle intelligence platform, designed to unlock new vehicle experiences. With Ultifi, we will connect with customers through software-defined features, apps and services via Over-the-Air (OTA). The new platform works by separating key software from the hardware to simplify the OTA process, enabling us to provide more robust updates and cloud-services to our customers.

The SDV organization works on ADAS software, Infotainment Services, AI-based Apps, Energy (EV) & Connected Mobility Services, Software Architecture, Systems Engineering, Software Integration, Product and Program Management- all to provide cool features such as Super Cruise and Ultra Cruise to our customers. We embrace innovation and would love for you to join us in transforming the way software is developed and deployed in vehicles.

Think this could be a good fit for you? Are you interested to be a part of a collaborative, driven, and bold organization that embraces innovation and challenges? If you have experience in electrical engineering, software engineering, or computer science/programming and you're ready to go all-in to deliver vehicles that evolve digitally with our customers' lives, let's connect.

The Image Processing Controls group is responsible for leading the software testing development and implementation of best in-class and real-time viewing applications based on surround and trailering cameras for GM vehicles with innovative computer vision-based algorithms for our customers.

Job Description:

As we move towards our ZERO ZERO ZERO future we are looking to add a hard working and creative engineer to our Autonomous Engineering team! As an Autonomous and Automated Driving Subsystem Validation Engineer, you will be responsible for the integration and validation testing of our various ground breaking vehicle subsystems such as Autonomous, Active Safety, Chassis Controls, Body Controls, Thermal Controls, and Propulsion Controls. In this exciting role, you will be directly accountable for requirements analysis, test procedure generation, test execution, test property modifications to support advanced testing methods, test issue reporting, and test documentation.

This position involves responsibility for development activities throughout a vehicle's lifecycle. Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our team is looking for a creative and highly energetic Systems Safety Engineer who can lead System Safety work and craft our approach for future innovations in the Active Safety, Automated Driving, and Autonomous Vehicle spaces! This work directly supports overall System Safety Case development for these technologies that are critical in achieving GM's path to Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions, and Zero Congestion! In this role you will apply systems level thinking and partner across the engineering organization to deploy System Safety solutions across our diverse and evolving technology set.

In this position you will be a fully-qualified contributor who has thorough knowledge and understanding of all aspects of the department. You will possess a broad technical knowledge, training and understanding combined with creative and independent thinking and conceptual ability to related work performed within their department. This position will have a focus for executing System Safety development for Advanced Driving Integration Module (ADIM) . In this role you will interact with the global product teams to ensure safety requirements are met according to the GM System Safety Process and industry standards.

Specifically, you will be responsible to lead risk analyses, develop safe solutions, identity/mitigate potential safety issues, and assist program teams to develop ADIM Systems free from unreasonable risk.

At General Motors we strive for a culture of excellence. We act with integrity. We are driven by ingenuity and innovation. We have the courage to do and say what's difficult. Each of us takes accountability for results, drives for continued efficiencies and has the tenacity to win.

Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description

GM is seeking Electrode Integration Engineer to join Chemistry Platform and Electrode Integration team. This candidate will work on the strategic direction and technology roadmap to design and develop electrode processes solutions and capabilities that achieves product performance goals by understanding the design space, and systematically working through design trade-offs to fabricate cathode electrode. This candidate will manage electrode integration projects to achieve design requirements set by the electrode design engineer, including safety requirement. The Integration Engineer will utilize the electrode Process of Engineering (POE) and the Analysis, Development and Validation (ADV) plan.

In this position you will be a fully-qualified contributor who has thorough knowledge and understanding of all aspects of the department. You will possess a broad technical knowledge, training and understanding combined with creative and independent thinking and conceptual ability to related work performed within their department. Promotes GM's values and makes customer-focused decisions.

This position requires sound technical knowledge and expertise related to the functional area of responsibility. You will need prior experience and/or knowledge of mechanical, instrumentation, electronics, testing/driving and fabrication. Translates business objectives to actionable work for the work group. Supports leading new processes and methods in line with departmental goals.

Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, tothe Traceandsoftware that demonstrates real-time data todrive intelligent optimizationsfor e-commerce.

To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team, based inPalo Alto,with offices in Atlanta and Detroit,that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.From engineering to product managementandoperations,BrightDropis looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and meticulous thinking to deliver a better future for generations to come.

Backed by General Motors,BrightDropis striving to improve the communities where we live! We currently have rare opportunities to join a fast-growing team in early stages of design, and to have a real impact on the products, technologies and work processes.



Senior Electrical Engineers to own and lead design and development of electronic sub-systems and modules, such as communications, processing, sensory, propulsion, power, etc.

Would you like to have a meaningful impact on the product and on the technology behind it? Do you know how to make things better, and have the passion and drive to go for it? Are you hoping for an engineering playground where you can ignite your creativity? If so, we're looking for YOU!

Title: Global Unix Systems Engineer III
Job_Description:
Job Description

This is a Hybrid position within BrightDrop. The role will allow employees to work remotely, but will also require onsite work based on business needs. The selected candidate will be expected to live a commutable distance to the innovation center they are selected for. Relocation will be provided as needed.

About BrightDrop:

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, tothe Traceandsoftware that demonstrates real-time data todrive intelligent optimizationsfor e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team, based inPalo Alto,with offices in Atlanta and Detroit,that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product managementandoperations,BrightDropis looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and meticulous thinking to deliver a better future.

Would you like to have a meaningful impact on the product and on the technology behind it? Do you know how to make things better, and have the passion and drive to go for it? Are you hoping for an engineering playground where you can ignite your creativity? If so, we're looking for YOU!

An Electrical Engineer to design and develop electronic modules and sub-systems for functions such as communications, processing, sensory, propulsion, power, etc. This is a rare opportunity to join a fast-growing team in early stages of design, and to have a real impact on the products, technologies and work processes.



Responsible for the design, development and validation of electronic boards, modules and sub-systems. Including all levels from concept and evaluation through design, schematics, layout, simulations, testing, bring up and integrations to release and production readiness .
