Title: Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview:
Why GM Financial?

If you have a vision of data and analytics as a service to support strategic initiatives using the latest tools, languages, and platforms in the cloud – we have the role, career, and challenge that you are looking for. Are you a builder, engineer, do you have a passion for data ops, MLOps and DevOps, are you a governance/metadata champion – look no further than GM Financial. In 2021, the Global Data and Analytics team received executive sponsorship and funding to build an enterprise cloud data and analytics platform. Our Mission is to partner with the business and technical teams to enable all users with data and analytics solutions. If you envision a world where innovative digital and cloud data platforms are built to transform customer contact, interaction and value through increased experimentation and insight generation, then GM Financial is the place for you.

At GM Financial, we’re looking for an experienced and highly motivated Data Engineer. The Data Engineer will help lead data transformation at GM Financial to support data science, analytics, and business teams globally. This role will be responsible for system API integration, data operations, engineering, pipeline development, and orchestration from ingestion through consumption zones. In this Agile environment, the Data Engineer will partner with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, and execution of data products. This role will ensure that all data products are available in the cloud to both business, and technical requirements.

Qualifications:

Title: Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview: The Risk Statistician plays a role in supporting the portfolio forecasting team, and providing statistical support and expertise to projects originating from the Portfolio Forecasting group within Risk Management. This position focuses on assisting in the design and development of complex portfolio forecasting models, analysis of credit performance within the broader auto finance market, and developing and maintaining credit score based loss models. These models are used to support corporate planning, financing loan pricing operations, and the Allowance for Loan Losses. In addition, this position is responsible for completing ad-hoc statistical analyses of factors relating to originations and portfolio performance, under the guidance of a Senior Statistician or AVP. Responsibilities: JOB DUTIES
Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated statistical forecasting models and analytical tools
Utilize data mining and advanced spreadsheet/technical skills to participate in complex forecasting, modeling, analysis, and reporting related to factors that affect portfolio performance

Job_Description:
Overview:
Apply ML pipelines, Data Science, and Data Engineering practices to design, develop, test, launch, and maintain MLOps capabilities. This position requires an understanding of the Data Science model development lifecycle, MLFlow architecture, and the benefits of ML development automation and deployment. A general understanding of cloud architectures, software development principles CI/CD, deployment, APIs, microservices, data dev ops, and event-driven cloud architectures is highly desirable. The ability to deliver solutions that are based on a business understanding is essential. Key responsibilities include enabling ML model automation, deployment, scalability, management, robustness, reusability, reproducibility, compliance, and responsible AI. This position requires expertise and passion for working in agile teams to plan effectively, collaborating with broader cross-functional teams, and successfully deliver mission-critical data and analytics projects.

Job_Description:
Job Description

The Sr. Data Analyst will be responsible to build, develop and execute data analytics for internal audit. This includes data analytic projects and continuous monitoring techniques executed with consistency and overall strategy, policy and procedures of the company. This position is located at the corporate headquarters in Detroit Michigan.

Key Responsibilities:

This position has responsibility to:
Lead collaboration efforts with business, IT, and internal audit to capture, prioritize and document data analytic requirements and drive measurable results
Lead team activities to analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and deliver useable insight to internal and external customers














The Senior Data Analyst will possess a combination of business knowledge, technical skills, people skills, and the ability to guide a data strategy. The candidate must possess technical expertise complimented by strong finance analytical abilities. The Senior Analyst must have the ability to manage the extraction, modeling, and front end solutioning of information from various finance databases using complex query statements and advanced database tools. The candidate must have skills to provide data analyses comparing the company's results to those of competitors and the industry, and to draw insights from the organization's data.

Title: Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Risk Statistician II is responsible for implementing the design, development, deployment, and maintenance of predictive models in Global Commercial Lending originations and credit risk. In addition, the position is responsible for ad hoc research projects involving optimization, data mining, and analyzing complex datasets, as well as researching innovative advanced statistical techniques.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES

Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated statistical models
Utilize data mining and advanced statistical skills to participate in complex modeling and analysis to develop models with the goal of improving operations and answering business questions

Qualifications:

Title: Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Risk Statistician II is responsible for statistical modeling and analytical efforts to support various projects originating from the Portfolio Analytics and Credit Risk Analytics groups within Risk Management. In addition, the position is responsible for ad hoc research projects involving project design, data collection and analysis, summarizing findings, and presenting results.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated statistical forecasting models and analytical tools
Utilize data mining and advanced spreadsheet/technical skills to participate in complex forecasting, modeling, analysis, and reporting related to factors that affect portfolio performance
Employ best practices of data analysis and model validation to ensure data results are accurate
Qualifications:

Title: Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview:
Apply ML pipelines, Data Science, and Data Engineering practices to design, develop, test, launch, and maintain MLOps capabilities. This position requires an understanding of the Data Science model development lifecycle, MLFlow architecture, and the benefits of ML development automation and deployment. A general understanding of cloud architectures, software development principles CI/CD, deployment, APIs, microservices, data dev ops, and event-driven cloud architectures is highly desirable. The ability to deliver solutions that are based on a business understanding is essential. Key responsibilities include enabling ML model automation, deployment, scalability, management, robustness, reusability, reproducibility, compliance, and responsible AI. This position requires expertise and passion for working in agile teams to plan effectively, collaborating with broader cross-functional teams, and successfully deliver mission-critical data and analytics projects.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES

Title: Build/DevOps Engineer - SDV
Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid: This hybrid position does not require an employee to be on site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired. This position supports in region hybrid and requires meeting on-site as needed

About GM

We're dedicated to achieving our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. We are looking for people who are passionate about helping us create safer, better and more sustainable solutions for personal mobility. Our bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.



Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.



General Motors is looking for passionate software engineers to help us build innovative connectivity solutions for our new Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) platform. We are seeking people who can help us push the limits of vehicle technology.

As part of our team, you will develop and integrate software for GM's sophisticated line of vehicle technology. Our group delivers software for GM's next generation connectivity and infotainment systems. We are looking for upbeat individuals who are passionate about software and have a desire to shape the automotive industry.

Title: Build/DevOps Engineer - SDV
Job_Description:
Job Description

AtBrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, toePalletsandsoftware that leverages real-time data todrive intelligent optimizationsfor e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team, based inPalo Alto,with offices in Atlanta and Detroit,that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product managementandoperations,BrightDropis looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and rigorous thinking to deliver a better future.

Backed by General Motors,BrightDropis striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.



In this Senior DevOps Engineer role, you will develop key elements of the infrastructure for BrightDrop's new electrified fleet. We are an innovation first team, and we need your help to ensure we meet the highest standards. In this new team we need your best creative thinking to create a beautiful and intuitive experience that you are proud of. Come join us and let's innovate!

Title: Build/DevOps Engineer - SDV
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePallets and software that leverages real-time data to drive intelligent optimizations for e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team - based in Palo Alto, with offices in Atlanta and Detroit - that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product management and operations, BrightDrop is looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and rigorous thinking to deliver a better future.

Backed by General Motors, BrightDrop is striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.

The Product Security team at BrightDrop ensures the security of our products and services and are the domain experts for our engineering and IT teams to protect our customers' data in today's dynamic threat landscape. We are a team of highly skilled security engineers that specialize in security research, penetration testing, and security architecture. We evaluate a broad range of technologies including sophisticated web applications, IoT platforms, distributed processing, Cloud environments and isolation of entrusted code.

As a you will be responsible for the implementation of security solutions in all aspects of Security. Work closely with product and platform teams to engineer and implement security controls with a focus on DevSecOps and automation.

Title: Data Engineer - OnStar Insurance
Job_Description:
Overview:
Why GM Financial?

If you have a vision of data and analytics as a service to support strategic initiatives using the latest tools, languages, and platforms in the cloud – we have the role, career, and challenge that you are looking for. Are you a builder, engineer, do you have a passion for data ops, MLOps and DevOps, are you a governance/metadata champion – look no further than GM Financial. In 2021, the Global Data and Analytics team received executive sponsorship and funding to build an enterprise cloud data and analytics platform. Our Mission is to partner with the business and technical teams to enable all users with data and analytics solutions. If you envision a world where innovative digital and cloud data platforms are built to transform customer contact, interaction and value through increased experimentation and insight generation, then GM Financial is the place for you.

At GM Financial, we’re looking for an experienced and highly motivated Data Engineer. The Data Engineer will help lead data transformation at GM Financial to support data science, analytics, and business teams globally. This role will be responsible for system API integration, data operations, engineering, pipeline development, and orchestration from ingestion through consumption zones. In this Agile environment, the Data Engineer will partner with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, and execution of data products. This role will ensure that all data products are available in the cloud to both business, and technical requirements.

Responsibilities:

Qualifications:

Title: Data Engineer - OnStar Insurance
Job_Description:
Overview:
Opportunity to work exclusively remote.

We are expanding our efforts into complementary data technologies for decision support in areas of ingesting and processing large data sets including data commonly referred to as semi-structured or unstructured data. Our interests are in enabling data science and search based applications on large and low latent data sets in both a batch and streaming context for processing. To that end, this role will engage with team counterparts in exploring and deploying technologies for creating data sets using a combination of batch and streaming transformation processes. These data sets support both off-line and in-line machine learning training and model execution. Other data sets support search engine based analytics. Exploration and deployment of technologies activities include identifying opportunities that impact business strategy, collaborating on the selection of data solutions software, and contributing to the identification of hardware requirements based on business requirements. Responsibility also includes coding, testing, and documentation of new or modified scalable analytic data systems including automation for deployment and monitoring. This role participates along with team counterparts to develop solutions in an end-to-end framework on a group of core data technologies. Other aspects of the role include developing standards and processes for data engineering projects and cloud initiatives.
Responsibilities:


Qualifications:

This role participates along with team counterparts to develop solutions in an end-to-end framework on a group of core data technologies. Other aspects of the role include developing standards and processes for data engineering projects and cloud initiatives.

Title: Data Engineer - OnStar Insurance
Job_Description:
Oportunity to work exclusively remote.
We are expanding our efforts into complementary data technologies for decision support in areas of ingesting and processing large data sets including data commonly referred to as semi-structured or unstructured data. Our interests are in enabling data science and search based applications on large and low latent data sets in both a batch and streaming context for processing. To that end, this role will engage with team counterparts in exploring and deploying technologies for creating data sets using a combination of batch and streaming transformation processes. These data sets support both off-line and in-line machine learning training and model execution. Other data sets support search engine based analytics. Exploration and deployment of technologies activities include identifying opportunities that impact business strategy, collaborating on the selection of data solutions software, and contributing to the identification of hardware requirements based on business requirements. Responsibility also includes coding, testing, and documentation of new or modified scalable analytic data systems including automation for deployment and monitoring. Why GMF Cybersecurity?

Our Cybersecurity team is tasked with the security engineering, regulatory response, third party risk, and incident response capabilities necessary to secure GM Financial, the captive auto finance subsidiary of General Motors. Reporting directly to the CEO, our Cybersecurity team enjoys unprecedented support to deliver the highest level of security capabilities using cutting edge technologies and automating mundane tasks, allowing our teams to focus on interesting and rewards security work. As a part of GM, you’ll have the opportunity to work on Cybersecurity projects across financial services, automotive, manufacturing, high-tech, and military industries. Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Data Analyst II supports the Credit Review department by utilizing technical expertise to develop new and enhance existing reporting, prepare monthly reports, and extract and analyze data in support of Credit Review's mission. This team member will serve as a technical expert for the department and will collaborate in designing reporting and ad hoc analysis to meet the needs of the department.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Develop SAS programs to generate datasets, tables, summaries and analysis utilizing multiple data sources, including an Oracle Data Warehouse
Collaborate with departmental managers to design, create and implement process and reporting solutions
Convert complex data into usable information using appropriate charts, tables and graphs to communicate results to management

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Salesforce Analyst II will serve as a partner with business representatives at all levels to identify needs, define, prioritize and document requirements for solutions to address business opportunities. This person must demonstrate a strong ability to create business requirement documents, lead business requirement gathering sessions, and create QA test scripts. This person must be skilled in delivering solutions using declarative configuration to create validation rules, workflows, process builders, as well as have a high level understanding of the technical requirements and functionality. The scope of work for this individual facilitates all stages of a project, from requirements gathering through testing and training.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Serve as a subject matter expert and project manager, and assist with the creation of project timelines, and ensure projects are delivered on time

Job_Description:
Overview:
The Product Development Analyst, Originations & Servicing is responsible for assisting in the development and implementation of strategies and programs that support the Originations and Servicing segments. This team member will support effective communication between internal external business partners as well as provide proficient reporting and analysis. The success of this position will be greatly dependent on this team member's ability to interface and develop relationships with peers, internal departments (i.e. Legal, Communication, Training, etc.), the Sales and Credit organization as well as external partners.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Assist in the development, implementation and rollout of program enhancements and/or new programs
Produce and maintain various reports that track and analyze data, program results and region trends

Perform in-depth analysis of moderate to complex financial information and prepare reports to assist management in making long-term and short-term decisions. Provides overall support to management.

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Job Description

People Analytics CoE (Community of Expertise) is looking for a People Analytics Data Visualization Analyst to join its newly formed Talent Acquisition Analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, building, and managing Global Talent Acquisition (GTA) dashboards that provide key insights on our internal and external talent attraction and hiring activities. You will be responsible for managing a portfolio of Talent Acquisition Power BI dashboards and moving them to the next level where insights and recommendations are seamlessly embedded in every user interaction and every single chart. You will provide meaningful, easy to understand and actionable insights by connecting talent acquisition data with critical business outcomes through powerful data visualizations. Your storytelling, consulting, and technical skills as well as ability to extract key insights from multiple data sources and to put business problems into visual context will have a significant impact on our ability to enable data-driven insights across the organization. This role requires a strong dashboard and visualization technical development experience and analytical consulting skills. You will have a chance to influence our talent strategy, help design insights that matter and be part of a great team that puts innovation and curiosity at the center of everything we do.

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Job Description

At BrightDrop, we are reshaping e-commerce by developing smarter, greener, and more efficient ways to deliver goods and services to your door, while delivering a brighter future for the cities where we live. We are building an ecosystem of all-electric, zero-emissions delivery solutions - from electric vehicles, to ePalletsandsoftware that leverages real-time data todrive intelligent optimizationsfor e-commerce. To deliver on our mission we are growing fast and building a team, based inPalo Alto,with offices in Atlanta and Detroit,that is customer-focused, agile and passionate about innovating for a more sustainable future.

From engineering to product managementandoperations, BrightDrop is looking for people who can combine a passion for technology and sustainability with high doses of curiosity and rigorous thinking to deliver a better future.

Backed by General Motors, BrightDrop is striving to improve the communities where we live and deliver a better future for generations to come. We hope you'll join us.

The exponential growth of e-commerce coupled with increasing end-customer demand for rapid delivery and an evolving regulatory environment present both an opportunity and challenge for logistics and other commercial companies, who currently don't have optimal solutions that meet their needs. With this in mind, GM has established a new BrightDrop business unit that provides an innovative approach to enable the efficient, multimodal movement of goods through an integrated product suite that leverages connected and electrified commercial vans, first to last mile delivery solutions and real-time fleet and asset management services.

In order to meet business objectives, the BrightDrop's Customer Success team is looking for a to develop and execute all demonstration and rollout activities towards the achievement of profitability and growth for the entire BrightDrop portfolio.

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Job Description

Do you have a perpetual curiosity and a knack to extract patterns hidden within mounds of data? Do you excel at using data techniques and analytical tools to tell the stories that aid business leaders to effectively define strategy, identify potential risks, and make critical decisions? Do you enjoy the challenge of data communication, adeptly conveying sophisticated data analysis clearly and concisely?

The Business Intelligence Data Analyst supports critical business operations and decision-making through creation of high quality, user-friendly, and automated dashboards, demonstrates data modeling and analysis techniques to create new organizational capabilities, and supports production operations through data discovery for risk mitigation and business action. We have a huge stake in data, and we need an authority like you to help us.

A successful Business Data Analyst demonstrates customer focus, a drive for results, and ease with ambiguous project requests and definitions; influences change, naturally accepts ownership of project work, explores opportunities to contribute to job responsibilities, and continues to develop critical skills and technical expertise. Projects will span across all time horizons, from early in VDP through end of production and often require integration of data across multiple functions, including Engineering, Program Management, Planning, Forecasting, Sales, and Manufacturing.

The Fleet Services Operations Analyst I under general supervision, formulates and defines business system requirements through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Job Description

Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.
This position requires an employee to be onsite 1-3 times per week.

Note: The selected candidate will be required to reside in the Warren, MI area.

The Sales Support organization is seeking individuals who have a passion for driving sales, dealer profitability, dealer and network performance through data insights. We are looking for individuals who are knowledgeable of the tools and reporting currently deployed in the Sales and Dealer Performance space and have a passion to transform that environment. As a member of Sales Performance Intelligence & Reporting team, you will work on a team to redesign and develop a suite of tools that empower our Field Teams, dealers, and our leadership with data and insights that improve current decision making, the operational aspects of dealer business management, and deliver insights that drive improvements to the business. This is a high-profile position with significant exposure to senior leadership and potential to influence Sales Performance Intelligence execution.

The Senior Business Analyst will have a unique opportunity to support digital solutions and technical tool strategies that drive value from a big data approach to advanced analytics. The goal of this role is to connect the business to underlying data assets & tools for analytics, predictive modeling, and automation to generate business value and efficiency, and to upskill our workforce to leverage the latest digital tools in ways that drive sales. The ideal candidate will possess business analyst skills, User Acceptance Testing skills, both strong quantitative and analytical skills, and strong business acumen and communications skills. This role will support Global Sales Reporting.

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Job Description

The Sr. Data Analyst will be responsible to build, develop and execute data analytics for internal audit. This includes data analytic projects and continuous monitoring techniques executed with consistency and overall strategy, policy and procedures of the company. This position is located at the corporate headquarters in Detroit Michigan.

Key Responsibilities:

This position has responsibility to:
Lead collaboration efforts with business, IT, and internal audit to capture, prioritize and document data analytic requirements and drive measurable results
Lead team activities to analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and deliver useable insight to internal and external customers














The Senior Data Analyst will possess a combination of business knowledge, technical skills, people skills, and the ability to guide a data strategy. The candidate must possess technical expertise complimented by strong finance analytical abilities. The Senior Analyst must have the ability to manage the extraction, modeling, and front end solutioning of information from various finance databases using complex query statements and advanced database tools. The candidate must have skills to provide data analyses comparing the company's results to those of competitors and the industry, and to draw insights from the organization's data.

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Sales and Credit Operations Analyst II-Dealer Services is responsible for the development and implementation of sales and credit operational strategies and programs that support Dealer Services (U.S. and Canada). The Sales and Credit Operations Analyst II compiles, integrates and analyzes data from a variety of proprietary internal and external databases, to facilitate efforts that support the originations efforts. This team member interfaces with the EVPs, Sales and Credit SVPs, Sales and Credit VPs, RSMs/RCMs, DARs/DRMs and other cross-functional departments to create consistent operational communication and dealer facing events that support the sales and credit divisions.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Responsible for the creation and implementation of sales and credit operational communication for the dealer customers and Dealer Services team members


Qualifications:

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Overview:
Risk Analyst - Credit Risk Analytics is responsible for analyzing credit risk exposure related to consumer and commercial loan and lease acquisition activities. The position involves conducting analysis to mitigate credit risk, create and monitor credit policy, measure credit execution and credit structure. In addition, this position will be responsible for monitoring credit performance by region, credit center, and dealership.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Utilize data mining and advanced spreadsheet skills to quantify credit risk related to loan and lease origination activities
Summarize findings, develop recommendations and present analyses to management in a clear, concise, convincing, and actionable format
Employ best practices of data analysis and validation to ensure data results are accurate
Qualifications:

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Data Enablement Analyst partners with business and technical stakeholders to increase data literacy, provide guidance on information-related issues, and ensure the organization has the appropriate governance in place related to the management and usage of business information. This role is expected to take an active leadership role in the development and refinement of GMF Data Enablement strategy and implementation. It is responsible for the coordination of Data Enablement initiatives and the identification of new opportunities to enhance the recognized value of Data Enablement within the organization.
Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES
Assist in the development of GMF Data Enablement strategy
Define and promote Data Enablement practices across the organization
Qualifications:

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Job Description

People Analytics CoE (Community of Expertise) is looking for a People Analytics Data Visualization Consultant to join its newly formed Data Visualizations & Analytics Solutions team. In this role, you will be responsible for providing meaningful, easy to understand and actionable insights by connecting people data with critical business outcomes through powerful data visualizations. You will set the vision for what "great" could look like when it comes to data visualizations and storytelling. You will be responsible for managing a portfolio of People Analytics dashboards and presentations and moving them to the next level where insights and recommendations are seamlessly embedded in every user interaction and every single chart. Your storytelling, consulting, and technical skills as well as ability to put business problems into visual context will have a significant impact on our ability to enable data-driven insights across our organization. This role requires a strong dashboard and visualization technical development experience and analytical consulting skills. What is in it for you? You will have a chance to influence our talent strategy, help design insights that matter and be part of a great team that puts innovation and curiosity at the center of everything we do.

Requirements:













This role can be a remote (anywhere in the United States) or a hybrid position (Detroit metro area).

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Job Description

In this role you will evaluate the overall resiliency framework (or develop new framework) for the purpose of risk identification, evaluation, prioritization, response, monitoring, reporting, and mitigation across GM's supply base. Key focus areas will include conducting assessment of risk by providing much greater depth of analysis on Mine to Tier X risks, geographic risks, and developments for components, acting as an independent steward of the long-term health of GM's supply chain, along with developing and supervising signposts for risks, in conjunction with regular review of relevant news, market participant interviews, prices, legislations and regulations across industries that could result in Supply Chain impact.

Title: Data Analyst II-Credit Review
Job_Description:
Overview:
Digital Marketing Analysts work across teams and channels to evaluate the effectiveness of the company's marketing efforts to support data-driven decision-making. This team member plays a critical role in matching the science of measurement with the goals of the business. Analysts are involved in all phases of the measurement and analytics process – from setting KPIs, to executing the analysis, to ultimately delivering insights. They work across teams, departments and disparate systems and tools to bring together the right data to support data-driven marketing decisions and uncover new areas of opportunity. This role will also oversee the company's SEO efforts. Analysts support a wide range of measurement activities on a daily basis such as: A/B testing, building dashboards in tools like Adobe Analytics, PowerBI or Tableau, and conducting analysis. They possess the hard skills in data and analytics, but also know how to deliver compelling and effective presentations that communicate insights and actionable recommendations.
